text: Muhammad Jamiruddin Sircar (born 1 December 1931) is a Bangladeshi barrister and politician. He was born in Tetulia, Panchagarh, Bengal Presidency, British India. He served as the acting President of Bangladesh in 2002. He served as the speaker of the Parliament of Bangladesh. He is one of the founding members of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party and was a member of the standing committee. He established Barrister Jamiruddin Sircar Collegiate Institute in his birthplace, Panchagarh in 1990. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Presidents of Bangladesh Category:Politicians from Rangpur Division Category:2nd Jatiya Sangsad members Category:5th Jatiya Sangsad members Category:6th Jatiya Sangsad members Category:7th Jatiya Sangsad members Category:8th Jatiya Sangsad members Category:9th Jatiya Sangsad members
title: Muhammad Jamiruddin Sircar
